meanings.definition: Showing disdain or contempt by a curt response or behavior.
meanings.sent1: She gave a snubbier reply than usual.
meanings.sent2: His snubbier attitude made others feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent3: The cat's snubbier look seemed to say, 'I don't have time for you.'
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds had a snubbier appearance as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's snubbier tone made the students uneasy.

meanings.definition: Comparatively more snub in manner or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The new sculpture looked snubbier than the old one.
meanings.sent2: Her snubbier haircut made her face look sharper.
meanings.sent3: The snubbier catwalk model tripped over her own feet.
meanings.sent4: The snubbier mountain peak stood out against the clear sky.
meanings.sent5: The snubbier edges of the puzzle piece didn't fit together.
